result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy J Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: with credit for 3 days time served

miscConds.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED. Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections as a condition of probation/extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

No contact with firearms.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.
Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

NO CONTACT with the victim,  without prior approval of agent or the court.
NO UNSUPERVISED CONTACT with persons under the age of 16 years.
NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy J Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Timothy J Smith in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Timothy J Smith in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proveeded.  Statements by counsels and defendant.  Additional statements by Gabriel P-D.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 24 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 3 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 12 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 12 MONTHS.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 24 MONTHS.  Conditions of probation include:
-Serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction STAYED for review on 6-6-2016.
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections as a condition of probation/extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim,  without prior approval of agent or the court.
-NO UNSUPERVISED CONTACT with persons under the age of 16 years.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;  Review hearing scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Timothy J Smith in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On motion of the State, Court ordered count 1 amended to PHYSICAL ABUSE OF A CHILD, Reckless Causation, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.03(3)(b), a Class I felony.  To the amended charge:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Count 2 is ordered dismissed and read in for sentencing on 1-7-2016.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Filed by the state:  Witness List; Motion in Limine

Defendant Timothy J Smith in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter set for trial on 12-14-2015.  There are no challenges to the statement; waiver of miranda-goodchild accepted by the court.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge KREMERS.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38.

Defendant Timothy J Smith in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 38.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Timothy J Smith in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Ben Lindsay for Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a Return of Doctor's Report Hearing. Court reviewed the Report from the Wisconsin Forensic Unit. Report indicates defendant is competent to proceed. Parties do not contest findings of the report. Court, finding defendant competent to proceed, reinstated proceedings and set matter for a Scheduling Conference.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Wisconsin Forensic Unit Report.

Defendant Timothy J Smith in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a Scheduling Conference.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit. Court ordered proceedings suspended. Order for Examination, signed and filed. Defendant to report to the Wisconsin Forensic Unit on 6/16/2015 at 9:00 AM for an evaluation with Dr. Pankiewicz. Case is adjourned for a Return of Doctor's Report in branch 23.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Timothy J Smith in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
JUDGE KUHNMUENCH FOR JUDGE GRADY IN BRANCH 23
Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Timothy J Smith in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Indigency Hearing, defendant now qualifies for SPD representation and Attorney Schwarz has been appointed. Hearing no longer required. Defendant WAVIED time limits as to Preliminary Hearing. Matter set for Preliminary Hearing in branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered a DNA sample be taken. Defendant was directed to the CJF for the sample to be taken.
Court also advised "You may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if you meet the conditions under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4)."
Case recalled at 3:24
Court withdraws order to take a DNA sample, as this case does not meet the requirements.
Court continues the signature bond previously signed in the county jail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.P. (DOB 4/23/01), Jessica P., and Gabriel P., as long as they are caretakers for A.P. (DOB 4/23/01).
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Timothy J Smith in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for indigency/bail bond hearing in Branch 23.
NO PLEA WAS ENTERED ON THIS DATE.  Indigency hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/20/15 @ 1:30 pm
